definition: outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
positive (electric.)/sun/male principle (Taoism)/Yang, opposite: 陰|阴[yin1]
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
overcast (weather)/cloudy/shady/Yin (the negative principle of Yin and Yang)/negative (electric.)/feminine/moon/implicit/hidden/genitalia

to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against

sentences.english: An honest man will scorn to act a double part.
sentences.chinese: 正直的人不屑於陽奉陰違。

sentences.english: As you know, it is well known how Qi treats missioner.
sentences.chinese: 可是你知道齊國對待使節陽奉陰違是出了名的。

definition: making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
unification and independence
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
fight to the death/desperate struggle
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
to capitulate

to play deaf-mute
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right

to criticize (as a matter of principle)
to decide alone without consultation/arbitrary/dictatorial
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
